note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to Note (2) following the title of subclass G05D and also the subdivisions of that subclass, according to which pressure regulators and flow regulators, e.g. flow regulating valves with pressure compensator, even with the whole regulating system contained in a valve, operating with or without auxiliary power, are covered by groups G05D16/00 or G05D7/00 , respectively. However, details of the valve parts, per se, are classified in the appropriate groups of this subclass.

title-part.text: Pedals or like operating members, e.g. actuated by knee or hip
Floats for actuation of valves or other apparatus
Means to prevent accidental or unauthorised actuation
to be locked or disconnected by means of a pushing or pulling action

CPC-specific-text.text: the locking mechanism being actuated by a separate actuating element
said actuating element being operated manually

reference.text: e.g. a push-button located in the valve actuator

CPC-specific-text.text: the locking mechanism being actuated by pushing or pulling the valve actuator, the valve actuator being rotated subsequently to bring the valve closure element in the desired position

title-part.text: using a removable actuating or locking member, e.g. a key
requiring setting according to a code, e.g. permutation locks
with locking caps or locking bars
with locking member actuated by magnet
Special means in or on valves or other cut-off apparatus for indicating or recording operation thereof, or for enabling an alarm to be given

CPC-specific-text.text: using a permanent magnet, e.g. in combination with a reed relays

with pivoted closure members, e.g. butterfly valves

title-part.text: with diaphragm, e.g. shaped as bellows or tube

CPC-specific-text.text: the diaphragm and the closure member being integrated in one member
for use with rotating spindles or valves
the part of the spindle traversing the diaphragm being rotatable or pivotable

title-part.text: with conical flange on the spindle which co-operates with a conical surface in the housing
with a flange on the spindle which rests on a sealing ring
sealing only when the closure member is in the opened position
Auxiliary closure means in valves, which in case of repair, e.g. rewashering, of the valve, can take over the function of the normal closure means
Devices for temporary replacement of parts of valves for the same purpose

CPC-specific-text.text: an auxiliary valve being actuated independently of the main valve
the auxiliary valve being a rotary valve
an auxiliary valve closing automatically when the main valve is being disassembled
the auxiliary valve being held open by the main valve
the main valve having a back-seat position, e.g. to service the spindle sealing

title-part.text: Means in valves for absorbing fluid energy

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. cushioning of opening or closure movement, eliminating of vibrations of the valve member
e.g. for sanitary applications, toilet flush reservoirs
for preventing water-hammer, e.g. damping of the valve movement
preventing noise in a single handle mixing valve

title-part.text: , the throttle being incorporated in the closure member

CPC-specific-text.text: and the closure member being rotatable

title-part.text: with a throttle in the form of a helical channel
and having a throttling member separate from the closure member,
in which the medium in one direction must flow through the throttling channel, and in the other direction may flow through a much wider channel parallel to the throttling channel
the throttling channel being of helical form
the throttling member being a perforated membrane
the throttling member being a cone
